image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: A Representative from Iowa; born in Carterville, Utah, October 8, 1915; at the age of 14 years moved with his parents to Lamoni, Decatur County, Iowa, and attended the public schools; graduated from Graceland College, Lamoni, Iowa, in 1934, University of Iowa in 1937, and State University of Iowa College of Law in 1939; was admitted to the bar in 1939 and commenced the practice of law in Leon, Iowa; county attorney, Decatur County, 1940-1944; served as a supply officer in the United States Navy 1943-1946, with service in the South Pacific Theater; city attorney, Leon, Iowa, 1946-1948; unsuccessful Democratic candidate for election to the Eighty-fifth Congress in 1956, and later unsuccessfully contested the election; elected as a Democrat to the Eighty-sixth Congress and served from January 3, 1959, until his death in Bethesda, Md., November 4, 1959; interment in Leon Cemetery, Leon, Iowa.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: United States. Congress (86th, 2nd session, 1960). Memorial services held in the House of Representatives and Senate of the United States, together with remarks presented in eulogy of Steven V. Carter, late a Representative from Iowa. Washington: Government Printing Office, 1960.

researchRecord.name: In the Donald J. Mitchell Papers, 1942-1968, 6 linear feet.
researchRecord.description: Persons represented include Steven Carter. A finding aid is available in the repository and online.

researchRecord.name: 1959, 1 item.
researchRecord.description: A letter from John F. Kennedy to Steven V. Carter written on July 25, 1959. In the letter, John Kennedy writes concerning U.S. ties with Latin America.

researchRecord.name: 1915-1960, 8.5 linear feet.
researchRecord.description: The papers of Steven V. Carter are arranged alphabetically within three series: 1) Congressional subject files 2) Pre-Congressional political files, and 3) Personal. The Congressional subject file series reflects his activities during his year in office. He concentrated on issues such as agriculture, education, insurance and retirement, and post offices. The pre-Congressional political files consist of campaign material from his two bids for office. Included are nomination papers, rules concerning contributions, and issue statements. The personal series contains invitations, law school notes, his degrees from college and university, material relating to his estate, and sympathy messages sent upon his death. A finding aid is available in the repository and online.

researchRecord.name: 1959, 1 item.
researchRecord.description: A letter from Lyndon B. Johnson to Steven V. Carter written on July 28, 1959. In the letter, Lyndon Johnson writes concerning American interests in Latin America.

researchRecord.name: 1959, 1 item.
researchRecord.description: A letter from Lyndon B. Johnson to Steven V. Carter written on July 20, 1959. In the letter, Lyndon Johnson thanks Steven Carter for his support.

researchRecord.name: In the Raymond W. Baxter Papers, 1956, 0.5 linear foot.
researchRecord.description: Correspondents include Steven V. Carter. A finding aid is available in the repository and online.

researchRecord.name: 1958, 1 item.
researchRecord.description: A letter from John F. Kennedy to Steven V. Carter written on March 31, 1958. In the letter, John Kennedy writes concerning his visit to Iowa.
